content:
MK looks up at Wukong, feeling the weight of the monkey king's glare as it bore into him. He shivered, wondering what the monkey king had in store for him next.

"Why do you want the diamond snare?" MK asked, hoping to distract Wukong from his current predicament.

Wukong's lips twisted into a sneer. "That's none of your concern," he said. "What matters is that I need it, and you're going to tell me where to find it."

MK shook his head. "I don't know where it is," he said. "I only know the old stories."

Wukong's expression darkened. "You're lying," he said, advancing on MK. "You humans are always lying. But I have ways of making you tell the truth."

He raised a hand, and a bolt of lightning shot from his fingertips, striking the barrier and sending sparks flying.

MK recoiled, pressing himself against the barrier, as Wukong continued to advance.

"Please," MK said, desperation in his voice. "I don't know where it is. I swear."

Wukong chuckled. "You humans are so pathetic," he said. "You can't even defend yourselves."

With that, he launched himself at MK, his fists slamming into the barrier with a force that shook the ground.

MK struggled to fight back, punching and kicking with all his might, but Wukong was too strong. He easily evaded MK's attacks, landing blow after blow.

As Wukong pummeled him, MK felt his energy begin to drain away. He knew he couldn't keep this up much longer.

"Stop!" he cried out. "Please!"

Wukong stepped back, laughing.

"You're no match for me," he said. "And you'll never escape this barrier, so you might as well cooperate."

MK slumped against the barrier, gasping for breath.

"I don't know where it is," he said. "Please believe me."

Wukong's eyes narrowed.

"I'll give you one more chance," he said. "Tell me where the diamond snare is, or I'll make you regret it."
